title: Bug: forge build fails when VIA_IR=true / optimizer=false; passes when both set to true
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [ ] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

nightly toolchain CI

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge build

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

When running `forge build` we get `Compiler run failed`

```log
Solc 0.8.15 finished in 440.43ms
Error: 
Compiler run failed
YulException: Variable var_amount_408 is 3 slot(s) too deep inside the stack.
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
```

However running the following command we get `Compiler run successful`
[source, justfile](https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-scripts/blob/master/justfile)
```shell
just dumpbuild
```
which is executing this command: 
```shell
ETHERS_SOLC_LOG=in=in.json,out=out.json; forge build --force
```

```log
Compiling 16 files with 0.8.15
Solc 0.8.15 finished in 13.67s
2022-06-29T11:16:28.173911ZTRACEcompile:ethers_solc::compile::project: compiled input, output has error: false
2022-06-29T11:16:28.173929ZTRACEcompile:ethers_solc::compile::project: received compiler output: ["src/contracts/ERC20.sol", "src/contracts/OpenMevPermitter.sol", "src/contracts/OpenMevRouter.sol", "src/contracts/OpenMevZapper.sol", "src/contracts/TwoStepOwnable.sol", "src/contracts/libraries/Babylonian.sol", "src/contracts/libraries/OpenMevLibrary.sol", "src/contracts/libraries/SafeTransferLib.sol", "src/contracts/libraries/Uint512.sol", "src/interfaces/IBentoBox.sol", "src/interfaces/ILendingPool.sol", "src/interfaces/IOpenMevRouter.sol", "src/interfaces/IProtocolDataProvider.sol", "src/interfaces/IUniswapV2Factory.sol", "src/interfaces/IUniswapV2Pair.sol", "src/interfaces/IWETH.sol"]
2022-06-29T11:16:28.174038ZTRACEcompile:ethers_solc::compile::project: handling artifact output for 16 contracts and 16 sources
2022-06-29T11:16:28.225891ZTRACEcompile:ethers_solc::cache: writing cache with 16 entries to json file: "/home/runner/work/OpenMevRouter/OpenMevRouter/cache/solidity-files-cache.json"
2022-06-29T11:16:28.240062ZTRACEcompile:ethers_solc::cache: cache file located: "/home/runner/work/OpenMevRouter/OpenMevRouter/cache/solidity-files-cache.json"
Compiler run successful
```

This is a private repo, but can give access if you need it
This is still an issue running on `forge 0.2.0 (f016135 2022-07-04T00:15:02.930499Z)`

```
$ forge build --force
[⠢] Compiling...
[⠃] Compiling 25 files with 0.8.15
[⠊] Solc 0.8.15 finished in 2.55s
Error:
Compiler run failed
YulException: Variable var_amount_404 is 3 slot(s) too deep inside the stack.
```

this is weird lol,

does the output of `forge config` match when invoked directly vs `just` match?

> this is weird lol,
> 
> 
> 
> does the output of `forge config` match when invoked directly vs `just` match?

Just uses the foundry.toml config in the root of the project, that is where its being executed. 

Edit: I will add justfile debug output as well lets go down this rabbit hole


Yes its weird, I have reproduced it on a linux box as well

> this is weird lol,
> 
> 
> 
> does the output of `forge config` match when invoked directly vs `just` match?

https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-scripts/blob/master/justfile

only changes are the two extra flags for build
This issue only occurs when using solc 0.8.15

Here is a reproducible way of triggering this error:

I confirmed this triggers this error with just doing `forge init` and then `forge build` before and then replacing the default toml file. @onbjerg / @mattsse 

```toml
[default]
allow_paths = []
auto_detect_solc = true
build_info = false
block_base_fee_per_gas = 0
block_coinbase = '0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000'
block_difficulty = 0
block_number = 1
block_timestamp = 1
bytecode_hash = 'none'
cache = true
cache_path = 'cache'
evm_version = 'london'
extra_output = []
extra_output_files = []
ffi = false
force = false
fuzz_max_global_rejects = 65536
fuzz_max_local_rejects = 1492
fuzz_runs = 1024
gas_limit = 9223372036854775807
gas_price = 0
gas_reports = ['*']
# ignored_error_codes
# 2018 Function state mutability can be restricted to pure
# 3420 Source file does not specify required compiler version!
ignored_error_codes = [
1878,
2018,
3420, 
5574,
]
initial_balance = '0xffffffffffffffffffffffff'
libraries = []
libs = ['lib']
memory_limit = 33554432
names = true
no_storage_caching = false
offline = false
optimizer = false
optimizer_runs = 1_000
out = 'out'
remappings = []
sender = '0xafFEaFFEAFfeAfFEAffeaFfEAfFEaffeafFeAFfE'
sizes = false
sparse_mode = false
src = 'src'
test = 'test'
tx_origin = '0xAaaaAaAAaaaAAaAAaAaaaaAAAAAaAaaaAaAaaAA0'
verbosity = 3
via_ir = true

[default.rpc_storage_caching]
chains = 'all'
endpoints = 'all'

[ci]
optimizer = false
fuzz_runs = 4069
force = true
verbosity = 4

```

When having both `via_ir` enabled and then disabling `optimizer` it causes this issue 

```diff
[default]
offline = false
+ optimizer = true
optimizer_runs = 1_000
out = 'out'
+ via_ir = true

[panic]
offline = false
- optimizer = false
optimizer_runs = 1_000
force = true
+ via_ir = true
```
the reason why it was passing with the `justfile` is because of an old dapptools env setting . https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-scripts/commit/205061fc42f35fe1286d2668c8830947810f1bb6

Closing this issue as its the underlying compiler, additional example: https://twitter.com/emo_eth/status/1546227810456416256


If your coming to this issue because of the error message you should:

Have both via_ir and optimizer enabled

potentially also leave optimizerSteps as an empty string: see https://twitter.com/leonardoalt/status/1542510231598510083

Thanks
